results.name: a(n) is the smallest prime such that exactly n prime pairs (p,q) exist with a(n) = p * q + p + q.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..115
Reinhard Zumkeller, Illustration of initial terms
program: a198277 n = a000040 . (+ 1) . fromJust $ elemIndex n a067432_list
v=vector(60);forprime(p=2,1e9, t=ct(p);if(t && !v[t], v[t]=p; print(t" "p))); v \\ with 0's for unknown; _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 24 2013
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 23 2011
